author: jsign
content:
Not sure if you refer to internal tooling for  clients (e.g: debugging, observability, etc) or dapp  developer tooling. 
Reg the latter, something that I think can be useful for contract developers is having better understanding on the new gas accounting 
e.g: code bytecode chunks touched in common txn execution use-cases (maybe compilers can optimize for this with hints?), or understanding how your data access if affecting gas costs (e.g: see if you can pack more things into the same stem)
also, something like https://evm.storage/ but for VKT would be nice (i.e: some state explorer)

author: ngweihan_eth
content: thanks for the pointers, will look into it ðŸ™‚

author: gballet
content: Good point by <@774033563732541451> : we don't really have a state/block explorer for displaying the verkle proofs & the state. I made https://github.com/gballet/verkle-block-explorer last year but it's very bare bones, and ideally we would like to tweak a real block explorer, i.e. adapt one of the existing ones. Nonetheless, this codebase has some really useful features, like the part that takes the proof, reconstructs the tree from it, and generates an image from it.
